poem:
Title: "Upon News of Unrest"

Leviathan, rearing in its slumber, churns-
the tethered world caught in infernal dance.
From Gaza to Lebanon, the lantern burns,
Yet, do we see the light, or just the lance?

Thirty thousand cries echo in our ears,
New voices now dubbed villainous, by law.
Do we confront the madness, or our fears?
In solitude, the poetics of war.
